metadata.title: CVE-2021-3347 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.10.11. PI futexeshave a kernel stack use-after-free during fault handling, allowing localusers to execute code in the kernel, aka CID-34b1a1ce1458.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3347` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1098-aws - 4.15.0-1098.105~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1112-azure - 4.15.0-1112.124~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1097-gcp - 4.15.0-1097.110~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1069-oracle - 4.15.0-1069.77~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').

linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1097.110~16.04.1').
